trial_identification.studytitle: A study of oral EMA401 in the treatment of pain following shingles to see if EMA401 can reduce the level of pain.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomised trial to prove the therapeutic concept and to determine the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic profile of EMA401 (angiotensin II type 2 receptor antagonist) administered orally in patients with postherpetic neuralgia.

interventions.interventions:
EMA401 sodium salt capsules (2 x 50 mg) will be administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily, taken on an empty stomach at least 1 hour before a meal (total 200 mg daily dose).
The two capsules on each dosing occasion should be taken orally with a minimum of 200 mL of water. The Treatment Period will be 29 days consisting of 28 days of twice daily dosing and a single dose on the morning of Day 29, to give a total of 57 doses, followed by 13 days (+/- 3 days) without treatment.
interventions.comparator:
Patients will be randomised in a 1:1 ratio to receive EMA401 or placebo.
Placebo capsules, identical to the active drug in appearance and contain the same excipients but not containing EMA401 sodium salt.
Two Placebo capsules will be administered twice daily, taken on an empty stomach at least 1 hour before a meal. The two capsules on each dosing occasion should be taken orally with a minimum of 200 mL of water.
The Treatment Period will be 29 days consisting of 28 days of twice daily dosing and a single dose on the morning of Day 29, to give a total of 57 doses, followed by 13 days (+/- 3 days) without treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in mean pain intensity score (using an 11-point numerical rating scale/Likert scale) between baseline and the last week of dosing (Day 22 to 28).
primaryOutcome.timepoint:
At Baseline (consists of daily pain scores recorded over 7 consecutive days during the Screening Period (week 0)) and at week 4 from intervention commencement.
The daily pain intensity score is averaged over 7 days to obtain the mean pain intensity score for a week.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Onset and maintenance of effect as defined by pattern of change in the mean pain intensity score over the entire Treatment Period.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At Baseline (week 0) and at 1 week, 2 weeks, 3 weeks and 4 weeks after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of patients achieving a greater than or equal to 30% reduction in mean pain intensity score compared to baseline
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At Baseline (week 0) and at week 4 from intervention commencement.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Corporate One, Suite G5, 84 Hotham St, Preston, VIC, 3072, Australia

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Corporate One, Suite G5, 84 Hotham St, Preston, VIC, 3072, Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a proof of concept study designed to investigate the efficacy of EMA401 when administered orally, twice daily (200 mg total daily dose) for 28 days in patients with postherpetic neuralgia aged 18 years old and over. The secondary objectives of the study are to determine the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic profile of EMA401 and to evaluate the efficacy of EMA401 using a number of alternate endpoints.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: The manuscript describing this clinical trial appeared online in The Lancet on 05/02/2014. Reference: doi:10.1016/S0140-6736(13)62337-5.
